DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate factor level pro coagulant factor II , VII , IX , X , anticoagulant factor protein C S healthy volunteer intake elevated level vitamin K order investigate whether evidence high dose vitamin K intake increase plasma coagulation factor activity .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Factors II , VII , IX , X , Proteins C S , Following High-dose Vitamin K Supplementation
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Recruit 8 male healthy individual prior history arterial venous thrombosis ( 2 follow age range : 20-34 , 35-49 , 50-64 , > 65 ) . 2 . Visit 1 : Measure baseline activity level Factor II , Factor VII , Factor IX , Factor X , level D-Dimer , TAT complex , protein C S activity . Also measure thrombin generation potential . Collaboration research laboratory seek also determine factor VIIa level . 3 . Visit 2 : Measure activity Factor II , Factor VII , Factor IX , Factor X , level D-Dimer , TAT complex , protein C S activity thrombin generation potential end 2 week period . 4 . Have individual consume 20 mg Vitamin K2 orally per day two week . 5 . Visit 3 : Measure Factor II , Factor VII , Factor IX , Factor X , D-Dimer , TAT complex , protein C S activity thrombin generation potential end 2 week period . 6 . Total length study 4 week . 7 . Analyze data set change level / activity due Vitamin K supplementation .
DOC.criteria: Healthy adult male prior history arterial venous thrombosis
